explanation: OCR converts scanned images of text into editable digital text.
OMR reads marks (bubbles) on forms. Used in exams, surveys.
MICR (Magnetic Ink Character Recognition) - special font on cheques for processing.
LED monitors use LED backlight. Energy efficient, thin. LCD with LED backlight.

prompt: Resolution of display is measured in?
explanation: Resolution is pixel count - width x height. 1920x1080 is Full HD.

prompt: Refresh rate of monitor is in?
answers: Hz - times per second screen updates
explanation: Refresh rate (Hz) - how often screen updates. 60Hz, 144Hz for gaming.
HDD uses spinning magnetic disks. Read/write head. Moving parts.
SSD has no moving parts. Flash memory. Faster, more durable than HDD.
SD (Secure Digital) card - removable flash storage. Cameras, phones.
USB 3.0 offers much higher transfer speeds than USB 2.0.
HDMI transmits uncompressed video and audio. Connects PC to monitor/TV.
Bluetooth Class 2: ~10m. Class 1 can be 100m. Varies by device.
LTE is 4G technology. High speed mobile data.
VoIP - voice calls over internet. Skype, WhatsApp calls.
Mbps = megabit per second. 8 bits = 1 byte. 100 Mbps = 12.5 MB/s max.

prompt: Kilobit Kb is different from Kilobyte KB?
explanation: 1 byte = 8 bits. 1 KB = 8 Kb. Small b = bit, Capital B = byte.
RAM speed in MHz (e.g., DDR4-3200). Higher = faster data transfer.
DDR transfers data on both rising and falling clock - doubles effective rate.

prompt: CPU cache L1 L2 L3 - which is fastest?
explanation: L1 is smallest, fastest, in each core. L2, L3 are larger, slower, shared.
Overclocking runs processor above factory speed. More heat, needs cooling.

answers: Heat transfer between CPU and heatsink
explanation: Thermal paste improves heat conduction from CPU to heatsink/cooler.
BIOS/UEFI is firmware stored in flash memory on motherboard.
UEFI (Unified Extensible Firmware Interface) replaces legacy BIOS. Faster boot.

answers: Software that lets OS communicate with hardware
explanation: Driver is software - enables OS to use hardware (printer, graphics card).
Firmware is low-level software in device. BIOS, router firmware.
